_header: Harkeneth speeches of many kind things
Note: Cf. French texts in Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Gg.1.1, f. 120; London, British Library Cotton Julius A.V, f. 177v; London, British Library Harley 746; Latin texts in London, British Library Cotton Vespasian E.VII, f. 89, abridged, and London, British Library Harley 6148.
Subjects: Merlin; prophecies, political; Henry IV, attack on
_description: ‘Prophecia de Merlyn’: The prophecy of the six kings to follow King John — 278 lines in short couplets

BodArcSelB8.Note:
See Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 214.

BodHat56.First Lines:
Herkyns spechis of mankyn thyngOf grete ferly &
                    wondryng…
BodHat56.Last Lines:
…Wele awey shull men sey þan aldir mosteAs stepchidren
                    þat aren for loste
BodHat56.Note:
Variant, 136 lines. On f. 43 before the start of the poem in the same
                    hand: ‘John Ermyte’.

BlCottGalEIX.First Lines:
Herkenes speches of manikyn thingesOf gret ferlys & of mani
                    kynges…
BlCottGalEIX.Last Lines:
…þus sall þe ayres of ingland kindepas out of
                    heritage als we here finde
BlCottGalEIX.Editions:
Hall,  Joseph. 
             The Poems of Laurence Minot.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1887; rev. ed., 1914: 103-11.
